intro: Agarista eriophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf agarista, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and silver-gray leaves that reflect light, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high elevations. Agarista eriophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native range.
